uk7QqulHjLq_GlfpNmeGrg.text: I'm obsessed with Mexican food. I had it at least once a week in California. You can imagine my excitement when I read that there was a Baja Fresh in Singapore. It's no taqueria but for being 9,000 of miles away, it is pretty awesome. There are fancy Mexican restaurants around but they don't serve simple burritos and tacos, and prices are extra steep. I ordered the Mexicana burrito with rice, chicken and beans. That's typically what I order in California. It was the right size and flavor, but the beans were way undercooked. I think they use dried black beans here, which is perfectly fine, but they need to be soaked longer. In the US, tortilla chips tend to be freshly deep fried before they are served. That way, they are warm and crispy. Here, they don't do that, which gives the chips a little bit of a stale flavor. If they would warm up the chips, that would be awesome! The salsas are perfect though, no complaints there! The roasted chile salsa is exactly like how I remember it, and I really appreciate the pickled jalapenos too. All in all, this is a step up from when all we had in Singapore was Taco Bell and fancy Mexican. We need these mid-level fresh "fast food" restaurants like Baja Fresh and Chipotle. I'm very thankful to whoever brought Baja Fresh to Singapore, and I'm sure the 25,000 Americans living here probably feel the same way!

Uh4WOIJruNhm9g2wwsRFhQ.text: I went during lunch and took the lunch set menu. It is actually a choice of main dish at a lowet price, but your options are limited. I went for the baja burrito which was filled with chicken, tomatoes, onions and guacamole. You get a bag of tortilla chips for free, for which you can grab a salsa (or more) from the free float salsa bar. The flavours were Ok, but for 10$ I would expect a bit more special.

jnVUfLrCunPf7SVOobHlAg.text: Popped by on a weekday at 5pm and was pleasantly surprised to learn that OCBC Frank card members are entitled to 30% off their bill from 230pm to 530pm. I got the Baja burrito with no meat, and got it stuffed with veggies. Side note: if you don't like capsicum (bell peppers) like me, you will spend heaps of time removing them!My burrito came pretty quickly, and all orders come with free chips, which you can get your salsa fix at the salsa bar, which allows you to get as much as you want. I wouldn't say their salsa is amazing, but it is hard to get good tomatoes in Singapore, so I can't say I blame them. There are varying spice levels of salsa for your choice, but I got heaps of cilantro and lemon and stuffed my burrito with them both. The burritos here are pretty large so come here hungry or get them to cut it in two so you can share with a not-so-hungry friend. Pay $2.25 extra for a drink.

photos.caption: Photo of Baja Fresh Mexican Grill - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Baja Fresh Mexican Grill - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Baja Fresh Mexican Grill - Singapore, Singapore

Kjws2msM49Py1E8xwTBA7A.text: $18+ for a chicken burrito and a coke. Add $2-3 for a different meat. Advertise "carnitas" but it's really just boiled shredded pork. Charge a service charge and GST for what? Bag of chips are cold and tasteless.  Don't foil wrap their burritos so its difficult and messy to eat them. Tasteless food. I get that they have pricey rent at this location, but there is no reason why the food they serve cannot be delicious. It's not.

adQ_GfFyj8bxY8BMUxME1g.text: So this a quick service Mexican food. You order from the counter but they serve the food to your table.Ordered the Baja burrito, Americano tacos and fajitas carnitas. All were pretty good and the portions were large. The drinks combo cost additional $2 were fountain drinks but the glasses provided were large.The free flow salsa bar seems ok but l guess can be better. There were several salsa and the one with black pepper was the best.The nacho chips and cheese sauce cost $2.95 each. May be it is free if you don't take it with the cheese.

photos.caption: Photo of Baja Fresh Mexican Grill - Singapore, Singapore. Back entrance
Photo of Baja Fresh Mexican Grill - Singapore, Singapore. The back entrance from the hotel area.
Photo of Baja Fresh Mexican Grill - Singapore, Singapore. Finished meal. Sorry so hungry that i forgot to take a photo of the food.

CqYpl7V1x0kcujtMGsdaEw.text: Went here for dinner with a few friends. The place is very lively and upbeat. The food was OK. They serve alcohol and that's a big plus.I'd recommend this place to anyone craving for Mexican food.

-WDSVTpCdOHn2NISutpYrQ.text: The service here was really good. They were quick to attend to us and ask us what else we would like to order, how is our food,  are we enjoying ourselves etc.However, I can't really say the same for the food. The prices are are quite steep despite being a fast-food place and is not justified by the quality of the food. The meat had grits in them. The salsa sauces, guacamole and sour cream were nothing spectacular. The soft shell tacos and burrito tasted quite bready. I did quite enjoy the quesadilla though! However, food overall was a disappointment. For such prices and at such a location, I expected better. Although the food wasn't horrible, it wasn't very good at the same time. Would probably not revisit.

3crGL6JTNVGQbGoJoHl71A.text: I am a huge fan of "fast food Mexican" in the USA. Chipotle is my favorite, followed by Free bird's. Baja Fresh is certainly a tad lower on the list. They are not super prevalent in Texas and they are a tad pricier than the first two I mentioned. I heard that there was a Baja Fresh in Singapore.  I have been craving Chipotle pretty much since the day we landed in Singapore. We sought out the Baja Fresh and I am so glad we did! I had a chicken bowl and the portion was HUGE. There is a salsa bar to jazz up your food (even though none of it is too spicy) and my very picky children loved the queso. They have very refined queso pallets. They consider themselves experts!The service was fast and the staff was friendly. They also had a deal where if you checked in on FaceBook, you got a free order of cinnamon churros! They staff was so kind to bring two orders (one for each of my children). My children have those rave reviews too! I believe Baja Fresh will be in regular rotation for us!

photos.caption: Photo of Baja Fresh Mexican Grill - Singapore, Singapore. Bare Chicken Burrito Bowl...huge portion, delicious and filling! Tastes like "home!"

JeQwrs-dIq4ZphQggTCp2A.text: I REALLY REALLY wanted to like this place, REALLY.But alas, I left disappointed.I had the ultimo chicken burrito, which wasn't all that bad, but the ingredients definitely didn't taste fresh at all.My wife had the Mahi Mahi taco platter and towards the end of the meal she mentioned how this is the fishiest fish taco she's ever had. I tried a bite to judge for myself and I almost gagged. Wow, that was disgusting. It's either really old fish, or really bad, but it definitely didn't taste like mahi mahi. It was totally disgusting. I was surprised my wife ate her meal and felt really bad for her at the same time.I guess you can't really compare to a US Baja Fresh restaurant, but this doesn't much resemble a Baja Fresh... they are doing the franchise a big disservice if this is how Asia will be introduced to the Baja Fresh brand.This used to be my most favorite chain mexican restaurant in California... now I shudder at the thought of going to it again.Also, the prices are pretty ridiculous. $33 for 2 tacos and a burrito.No wonder the place was more than half empty during dinner time.

photos.caption: Photo of Baja Fresh Mexican Grill - Singapore, Singapore. disgusting mahi mahi tacos

VafDHwGIoARPdnmsOjvIPw.text: I loved the taco chips served and the salsa. Mexican food never disappoints but the portions were slightly small and expensive, as compared to other Mexican food options like stuff'd.

3hbc5UMh27R3_X5IiCpv6Q.text: We tried the fish soft tacos, burrito and a fajita. I find the taste rather normal. It definitely has the novelty factor in Singapore where affordable mexican food is rather rare to find.Price wise, its cheaper than your regular mexican place but more expensive than a regular fast food place. Taste is average to above average. Service could use a bit more cheer.Decent options and customization is possible.

V1q2fFCWRSMzvzWj9iVP_g.text: HORRIBLE!!!!!!! Baja Fresh Singapore should learn from Baja Fresh California.I'm from San Diego California, I go to Baja Fresh all the time over there. Over here however... I'll NEVER eat here again. First of all $30 for a beer and buritto? are you kidding me? The buritto was tasteless, the salsa had a heavy black pepper taste, it's NOT Mexican!!! This was the most expensive and worst tasting thing I've had, it's so bad I won't even call it Mexican food.DON'T EAT HERE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

0iYbrlLl22pSKzNzafs6aQ.text: Although it has the salsa bar counter just like the ones in the U.S.,, I was not impressed with the food here. The chicken fajitas came cold.

8cIFs2jw1vhzpjOfHkoCkQ.text: Mexican food is good for my soul! Located inside Hotel Rendezvous, it's unassuming exterior doesn't leave an impression. In fact the first few times I walked passed it without even noticing it was there!It's Mexican fast food but slightly pricier. Expect I pay about $15 per person for a set with drinks. I really love their burritos - I'd have an Ultimo steak burrito if I'm starving as the rice in it gets you pretty full up, or the Baja on a normal hunger scale as its got guacamole, meat and tomatoes but no rice.You can choose between chicken, beef, shrimp, pork or fish options, so there's something for everyone! Every set comes with a serve of nachos, and free flow servings of freshly made salsa and salsa sauces. I always go nuts on the fresh salsa. They promise that everything is fresh, so nothing from a can or freezer is used -which makes a remarkable difference. No reservations here, just walk ins so be prepare to wait if you come after 7pm. Fortunately, people leave quite quickly after eating so waiting time won't be too long. Ambience isn't great, but it's clean and comfortable, so i really enjoy my meals there.

photos.caption: Photo of Baja Fresh Mexican Grill - Singapore, Singapore. So many different types of salsa!!!
Photo of Baja Fresh Mexican Grill - Singapore, Singapore

_LqwdVgNYq26KrCC2rUxXw.text: This American mexican good chain has a store in Singapore, in fact, their Singaporean store is the first in Asia. The store concept is nice, kinda made me feel like I've stepped into another country for a brief second (Nando's Singapore gave me that feeling too the very first time I went). As you can see from the name, Baja Fresh is all about serving fresh food and not fast food. The concept is very much fast food a fast food restaurant style, you line up, order, pay and sit down to have your meal.It's a little pricey compared to McDonald's but the food quality you get is plenty better. Although, I wished that we didn't have to  You also get an unlimited top up when it comes to taco chips with a variety of salsa sauces, unlimited top up is always a good deal. I've tried the shrimp burrito, it was full of shrimp... very generous for a franchise (I hope they don't start reducing the quantity once business gets good)and it left a good impression on the tastebuds too! I'm no expert on mexican food but I was happy with this experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Baja Fresh Mexican Grill - Singapore, Singapore. Fast food style ordering counter
Photo of Baja Fresh Mexican Grill - Singapore, Singapore. Baja Fresh Store front.

l6VWIrej7W_B1jlOpi7UjQ.text: Closest thing you'll get to decent and (relatively) inexpensive Mexican food is probably Baja Fresh. Most Mexican places here are more of a sitdown, bougie (read: Bourgeoisie) style where you'll pay 20 bucks for a taco. Because it would be a cold day in hell (theres a joke in there about Singapore's weather somewhere) before I'd pay that much for a burrito, I spent a good amount of time on the hunt.After many sweaty treks through the city searching for a burrito, I happened to pass Baja Fresh one day on the way home. My prayers had been answered! While not 'the best thing I've ever had', Baja Fresh definitely hit the spot and fulfilled my craving. It's a shame that there's not more places where you can get a grab-n-go burrito (for a city that prides itself on eating, this is even more surprising). Alas, if you're like me, an American craving some south of the border fare, Baja Fresh will suffice.

uqF3bRke_rpadH7ba5raRg.text: I've never really had Mexican food before in Singapore. It just isn't as big here compared to Japanese or even Italian. So one day when my girl friend asked where we should go for dinner I decided to be adventurous and suggested Baja Fresh which I've heard and seen before!I was actually quite surprised when I went in because it is a fast food concept restaurant instead of a proper one. So you place your order at the counter and will be given a number, after which a wait staff will pass you the food.We were so confused when we first tried to order too! Everything is new to us, and there are not many pictures we can use as reference on the menu. The counter staff was really helpful though - she patiently explained each food to us and made recommendations.Really enjoyed the taco chips they gave as appetizers as well which you can dip into 5 types of salsa. Very fun!Our food was also very good. It was fresh! I never thought mexican food to be like that to be honest. Always had the image that it's all guacamole and beans.Go try it out now and see what I mean!

6_ypGJM4ROH2DqJ6XK3BXg.text: I love Mexican food and I cook Mexican. Was looking forward to visiting the newly established Baja Fresh for quite some time before I finally got around to doing it. A meal here typically cost $15/person (unhappy me!), but it's still one of the cheaper Mexican food place in Singapore. It's fast-food restaurant styled; I totally disliked reading their menu. It was confusing.The meal was ok, really filling portions of nachos, tortillas, chicken(filling choice), cheese and drinks. it's free-flow salsa, 4 choices with my favorite being the 6-chile blend. They have a really general range of tex-mex food on their menu though; burritos, quesadillas, tacos, fajitas & nachos. The Mexicans will be angry they call these Mexican.They have an amazing group of staff working for them though and I like how these people made my experience at Baja Fresh so much better. I'd come by again to try other items; i think the salad in the corn tortilla bowl looks really interesting.

7-W34LqLlirUDRtoauuxvw.text: love the baja burrito!i always order my steak baja burrito really well done (asked them to cook it a little bit longer than normal). love the chips, and the salsa bar.price is a bit steep..but it's worth it. thank you chandra for the tip about making the steak burrito really well done :)...now..if only chipotle would open a branch in singapore...my life would be complete (almost) :)

PgE6OQrKA1bgYc9tjm2u_A.text: Finally a place in Singapore that serves decent Mexican food!Baja Fresh is a Mexican chain from the states that serves fresh and healthy fast food. Be warned though, although this is technically a 'fast food joint' you are not going to be paying fast food prices. Its a bit pricey, but you are definitely getting what you pay for. All their food is made fresh and served fresh with really good ingredients. Portions are huge and you can help yourself to the salsa bar where there are different types of salsa. They also serve alcohol here which you dont see in other fast food restaurants. Id say one of the best places to get Mexican food in Singapore.

0eurZgSHPXEko-YD1h36hw.text: When Baja Fresh's location was under renovation I was quite excited, because hey, tacos, and I don't have to go to Phoenix Park for it! Unfortunately, it's fast food that tries to be fresh but isn't really--don't get me wrong, it's not that the lettuce is wilting, but when you know that the char marks aren't real and the guacamole tastes like avocado juice from the Indonesian stall there isn't much that brings me back. There is a certain honesty in properly trashy fast food like Taco Bell, IMHO. That said, Taco Bell doesn't do beer. :)
